notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 3r) Her onginneð seo boc þe man prosius nemneð

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 3r) Vre yldran ealne ðysne ymbhƿyrft on þreo | to dældon

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: ( fol. 7r) Hu god dyde romanum his miltsunge

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 7v) VRE YLDRAN EALNE ÐYSNE YMBHǷYRFT ÐUSES MIDDANGEARDES CǷÆT OROSIUS. | sƿa sƿa oceanus ymbligeð utan ðone man gar | segc hatað on ðreo to dældon ˥ hu hy þa þry dælas on | ðreo to nemdon asiam europam ˥ africam

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 28v) Her | endað sio forme boc. ˥ onginð sio æftere

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 28v) IC ǷENE CǷÆÐ OROSIVS | ÐÆT NAN WIS MANNE SY BUTAN HE GENOH GEARE ǷITE. ÐÆT | god þone ærestan man rihtne ˥ godne gesceop | ˥ eall mancynn mid him

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 42r) Ne ƿene | ic cƿæð orosius nu ic lange spell hæbbe to segcenne || þæt ic hy on þysse bec geendian mæge ac ic oðere ongin | nan sceal

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 42r) ÆFTER ÐAM ÐE ROME | BVRH GETIMBRAD ǷAS III HUND ǷINTRA ˥ LUII ON ÞAM | dagum þe gallie rome aƿest hæfdon ; Þa geƿearð | seo mæste sibb ˥ seo bysmorlecoste betƿih læce | demonium creca londe ˥ persum

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 63r) Ne furþon þaet þa ƿoldon gefryn beon þe ƿæron ge | broðra of fæder ˥ of meder

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): (fol. 63r) INCIPIT LIBER QUARTUS

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 63r) ÆFTER ÐAM ÐE ROMEBURH GETIMBRED | ƿæscccc. hund ƿintrum˥ lxiiii. gum þæt taren | tine þæt folc plegedon

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 83r) Sƿa þonne is me nu | sƿiðe earfeðe heora mod to ahƿettane nu hit na | ðor nele beon ne scearp ne heard

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English and Latin

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 83r) I. Hu ororius spræc umbe romana gylþ

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 83v)XV Hu sume ispania ƿæron aguster ƿiðerƿinnan.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 84r) IC ǷAT CǷÆÐ OROSIUS. HǷÆT SE ROMANA | gilþ sƿiðost is

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 96r) her endað seov. boc. ˥ ongingð seovi.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 96r) Hu orosius ƿæs sprecende ymb þaiiii. anƿealdas | þaraiiii. heafodlice þisses middangeardes

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 97r) Hu god gedyde romanum his miltsunge

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 97r) NU IC ǷILLE CǷÆÐ OROSIVS ON FOREǷEARDRE | þissevi. bec gereccean þæt hit þeah godes bebod | ƿæs þeah hit strang ƿære. Hu emlice. þa feoƿer | anƿealdas þara feoƿer heafodrica þisses middan | geardes gestodon

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 111v) Siþþon sætan þa gotan | þær on lande. sume be þæs caseƿer ƿillan. Sume hi foran on ispanie. ˥ þær | gesætan. Sume on affrice

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 112r) CRIST ǷÆS ACEN | NYD CYNINGA ǷVLdor | on middne ƿinter mære þeoden ece ælmihtig on | þy eahteoðan dæg hælend gehaten heofon rices | ƿeard.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 114v) nu gefindan magon | haligra tiid þe man healdan sceal Sƿa bebugeð gebod | geond brytenricu. sexna kyninges on þas sylfan tiid.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 115r) CYNING SCEAL RICE HEALDAN

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 115v) næni eft cymeð hider under hrofas. þe þæt her | for soð mannum secge hƿylc sy meotodes gesceaft | sigefolca gesetu þær he sylfa ƿunað

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 115v) Æscnesselx. ƿintra galius iulius se casere | ærest romana brytenland gesohte. ˥ bryt | tas mid gefeohte cnysede ˥ hy ofersƿiððe. ˥ sƿa þeah || ne mihte þær rice geƿinnan

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 164vexplicit occurs on fol. 162v, which is now out of order but the last folio on which part of this text occurs is 164v) ˥ þær ƿar | harold cyning of norƿegum ˥ tostig eorl ofslagen ˥ ungerim | folces mid heom ægðer ge normana ge englisca ˥ þa normenends imperfectly

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 164r) begins imperfectly to follow on from 11th century copy flugon þa englisa. Ða ƿes þer an of norƿegan þe ƿiðstod þet en | glisce folc þet hi ne micte þa brigge oferstigan ne sige ge | rechen

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 164r) ˥ þes cyninges supart illegible het | mundus let harold faran ham to norƿeie mid alle þa scipe

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

objectDesc.extent:
c. 280 mm x 195 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
215-224 mm x 130-136 mm (dimensions of all - size of written space).

handDesc.summary: Some of the hands in the manuscript share characteristics which can be found in contemporary

characters.note: Long s with tapered descender and a hooked head which at times almost closes on itself.
back-stroke ð with long ascender ending with a tail to the left and a cross-bar with a right-side dot to the right.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fols 162r/7-162v. Round and small minuscule very similar to the one immediately preceding it.

characters.note: Long s with short descender, finishing just below the line of writing and a short hooked head.
Small d with short ascender almost upright.
Back-stroke ð with long ascender ending with a very short tail to the left. At times especially in double ð, the ascender curves slightly to the right.

hands.name: main text
hands.description: Fol. 164r. A larger minuscule with letter forms of squarish proportion, which retain the special insular letter-forms.
hands.summary: Retains the special insular letter-forms except:

characters.note: d: round back with curved ascender to the left.
Tironian Nota is, in two cases, short with curved descender to the right and almost sitting on the line of writing.

binding: Repaired and rebound in 1839. Rebound in 1865 and again in 1957.

history.origin: Unknown. Ker notes that from 977 onwards there are local entries relating to Abingdon (1957, p. 253), although O'Brien O'Keeffe argues that the ascription of an Abingdon provenance is mainly due to tradition and is difficult to sustain (2001, pp. lxxiv-xcii and 2003, p. 1) Considering the analysis of some of the hands, it likely that there is also a layer of production in Worcester.
history.provenance: May have been in Abingdon from s. ximed (Ker 1957, p. 253).
history.acquisition: O’Brien O’Keeffe reports that the manuscript was owned by Robert Talbot, prebendary of Norwich (d. 1558), during which time Robert Recorde (d. 1558) made extracts from the Chronicle (2003, p. 1). John Leland (d. 1552) copied some of Talbot’s annotations and glosses into his Collectanea. Laurence Nowell copied part of Chronicle in London, British Library, Add. 43704. William Bowyer (d. 1576), Keeper of the Records in the Tower of London. Robert Cotton acquired the manuscript as a result of an exchange with Robert Bowyer by exchange, as recorded in the 1621 Cotton catalogue (British Library, Harley 6018, fols 154v, 158r). Acquired by the British Museum along with the rest of the Cotton library.

admin: Manuscript described by Mary Swan with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and Sanne van der Schee, hand descriptions by Orietta Da Rold; ed. by Takako Kato (2010; 2013).
